events.description: Preliminary estimates of Italy's annual and monthly inflation rates for January 2026.

facts.fact_text: Italy's annual inflation rate fell to 1% in January 2026 from 1.2% in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Italy’s annual inflation rate edged down to 1% in January 2026 from 1.2% in the previous month

facts.fact_text: The core inflation rate, excluding energy and fresh food, remained at 1.8%.

evidences.evidence_text: The core inflation rate, which excludes energy and fresh food, held steady at 1.8%

facts.fact_text: Italy adopted the ECOICOP version 2 classification and a new 2025=100 reference base.

evidences.evidence_text: following the adoption of the ECOICOP version 2 classification and a new 2025=100 reference base for consumer prices.

facts.fact_text: Monthly consumer prices rose by 0.4% in January.

evidences.evidence_text: On a monthly basis, consumer prices increased marginally to 0.4%, from 0.2% in December

facts.fact_text: The EU-harmonized inflation rate decreased to 1% in January.

evidences.evidence_text: The EU-harmonized inflation rate eased slightly to 1% in January 2026, from 1.2% in the previous month.

claims.claim_text: The annual inflation rate was in line with market expectations.
claims.author: Market Analysts

evidences.evidence_text: in line with market expectations, preliminary estimates showed.

claims.claim_text: The monthly increase in consumer prices matched market expectations.
claims.author: Market Analysts

evidence.evidence_text: Prices for food products rose at a faster pace, supported by both unprocessed (2.5%) and processed (2.2%) items.
Costs also accelerated for housing-related services (4.4%)
The core inflation rate, which excludes energy and fresh food, held steady at 1.8%
